original_title: Sri Lanka to link wages and pensions to inflation: President
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka plans to link wages and pensions to inflation, President Ranil Wickremesinghe said as the country’s 12-month inflation was pushed to 70 percent in 2022 by the central bank.
“We expect to adjust salaries and wage to inflation,” President Ranil Wickremesinghe told parliament during a statement on an International Monetary Fund agreement.
“But this adjustment will be done within the limits of a primary deficit.”
Sri Lanka has keep annual targets on the primary deficit under the IMF program.
Related Sri Lanka meets 4.0-pct primary deficit target for 2022
Sri Lanka has already over-performed on the primary deficit of 954 billion rupees in 2022 by around 59 billion rupees.
